Detection of unusual process accessing w.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4688 for process creation on endpoints. Correlate process creation events with endpoint monitoring logs or system calls indicating access to webcam devices or video capture APIs. Identify processes with low frequency across the environment or processes not typically associated with video conferencing or camera use. Use frequency analysis of process names accessing camera-related APIs to flag outliers.

Creation of unexpected video or image fi.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4688 for process creation on endpoints. Identify processes exhibiting high write activity or creating files with video/image extensions (.mp4, .avi, .jpg, .png, etc.) in unusual directories. Analyze the file sizes created by processes using descriptive statistics (e.g., mean, median, distribution) and flag processes creating unusually large files or a high volume of files, particularly if the process is not a known legitimate application that handles multimedia.
